data.title: Fifty four large investors managing 1 trillion pounds ($1.41 trillion) in assets have launched a campaign to curb the use of antibiotics in the meat and poultry.
A man has been arrested for trying to assassinate the chief forensic expert in MH17 probe
Scientists have for the first time scanned the brains of people using LSD and found how brain in a psychedelic drug state mimics mind of a baby: free and unconstrained.
China Says 80% of Tested Wells Had Water Too Polluted to Drink

Saudi blogger Raif Badawi, who was sentenced to 10 years in prison and 1,000 lashes for publishing a liberal blog, is to be awarded the International Publishers Association’s Prix Voltaire for his contribution to freedom of speech.

Turkey asks Germany to prosecute comedian for insulting Erdogan
Goldman Sachs to pay $5bn for its role in the 2008 financial crisis

Police station attacked in S. Russia, suicide bombing feared
President Obama: Libya aftermath 'worst mistake' of presidency
Number of wild tigers in the world rises 22%, For the first time in almost a century, there has been an increase in the global tiger population.
World's smallest diode created out of an 11 base pair DNA molecule by joint American and Israeli research team.
Some people appear to be born with 'superhero DNA' that cancels out genetic diseases like cystic fibrosis, say researchers.
A SpaceX Dragon cargo ship delivered the first inflatable room for astronauts to the International Space Station on Saturday, two days after launching from Cape Canaveral.
